results.title: Sheep: handle with care. Parts I-III
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A three part program that shows the different aspects of sheep management. Part 1 deals with Mustering, mouthing, teeth trimming, drenching and foot care. Part 2 deals wth crutching, vaccinating, lamb marking and drafting. Part 3 deals with shearing, branding, dipping and jetting

results.title: The Rabbit in Australia
results.brief_description: The introduction of the rabbit into Australia and the resultant long battle to contol it. Notes how the rabbit feeds, breeds and survives in different parts of Australia. No other credits available.

results.title: Pictures and words
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television training film”.
Deals with the art and techniques of writing film commentaries. Illustrates the best way of making shot lists, timing the words with the pictures, and letting the pictures speak for themselves. Shows the pitfalls of various techniques, how the same pictures can tell a different story with a different commentary and what a skilful writer can do. Ends in the dubbing theatre with commentary, music and effects being recorded to the pictures.

results.title: Videotape editing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television training film”
Describes techniques of editing in videotape recording for television. Commencing with part of a live studio program being recorded on tape and passing on to a detailed description of how video tape recording machines work.

results.title: Organics: food for thought
results.creator_credit: Jim Testa, Mike Laker and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs
results.brief_description: Organic farmers work with nature rather than against it, a process of positive cooperation with the soil, without the intervention of chemicals, in order to produce a quality product. Filmed on location in Victoria, this video covers the production, marketing, export potential and labelling of organic produce in Australia. It features citrus grower, Robert Ridgewell; bio-dynamic wheat/sheep farmer, John Greenwood; vegetable grower, Neville Cann and Ian Diamond, organic wholesaler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Testa, Mike Laker and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs

results.title: One hundred harvests
results.creator_credit: Robert Hesselschwerdt and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: A historical review of the work done on cereal breeding since the establishment of the Department of Agriculture in 1872. Includes shots of many old farming implements housed in the Historical Museum of Jeparit. Shows stages in the development of new varieties of wheat at Werribee Research Farm. Made in connection with centenary of the Department.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Hesselschwerdt and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture

results.title: Olympic fragments
results.creator_credit: John Sanborn, John J. Godfrey, Bob Artell and Kit Fitzgerald
results.brief_description: Commissioned for the 1980 Winter Olympic Games in Lake Placid, New York, Olympic Fragments is a taut, expressive reinterpretation of athletic movement, a tour-de-force of dynamic editing and post-production techniques. Through sophisticated visual and aural juxtapositions, Fitzgerald and Sanborn isolate the gestures and movements of athletes in a controlled, powerful display. Eschewing the ‘thrill of victory’ tradition of broadcast television sports coverage, they allow a portrait of individual skill and grace under pressure to emerge from their manipulation of highly fragmented and choreographed imagery — what they term the ‘skill, beauty and sheer joy of kineticism.’
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Sanborn, John J. Godfrey, Bob Artell and Kit Fitzgerald
